segment.source: Shutdown Clear virtual memory pagefile (Windows 10)
segment.target: Shutdown Clear virtual memory pagefile (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Shutdown Clear virtual memory pagefile security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Shutdown Clear virtual memory pagefile security policy setting.

segment.source: Shutdown: Clear virtual memory pagefile
segment.target: Shutdown: Clear virtual memory pagefile

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Shutdown: Clear virtual memory pagefile security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Shutdown: Clear virtual memory pagefile security policy setting.

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: This policy setting determines whether the virtual memory paging file is cleared when the device is shut down.
segment.target: This policy setting determines whether the virtual memory paging file is cleared when the device is shut down.

segment.source: Virtual memory support uses a system paging file to swap pages of memory to disk when they are not used.
segment.target: Virtual memory support uses a system paging file to swap pages of memory to disk when they are not used.

segment.source: On a running device, this paging file is opened exclusively by the operating system, and it is well protected.
segment.target: On a running device, this paging file is opened exclusively by the operating system, and it is well protected.

segment.source: However, devices that are configured to allow other operating systems to start should verify that the system paging file is cleared as the device shuts down.
segment.target: However, devices that are configured to allow other operating systems to start should verify that the system paging file is cleared as the device shuts down.

segment.source: This confirmation ensures that sensitive information from process memory that might be placed in the paging file is not available to an unauthorized user who manages to directly access the paging file after shutdown.
segment.target: This confirmation ensures that sensitive information from process memory that might be placed in the paging file is not available to an unauthorized user who manages to directly access the paging file after shutdown.

segment.source: Important information that is kept in real memory might be written periodically to the paging file.
segment.target: Important information that is kept in real memory might be written periodically to the paging file.

segment.source: This helps devices handle multitasking functions.
segment.target: This helps devices handle multitasking functions.

segment.source: A malicious user who has physical access to a server that has been shut down can view the contents of the paging file.
segment.target: A malicious user who has physical access to a server that has been shut down can view the contents of the paging file.

segment.source: The attacker can move the system volume into a different computer and then analyze the contents of the paging file.
segment.target: The attacker can move the system volume into a different computer and then analyze the contents of the paging file.

segment.source: This is a time-consuming process, but it can expose data that is cached from RAM to the paging file.
segment.target: This is a time-consuming process, but it can expose data that is cached from RAM to the paging file.

segment.source: A malicious user who has physical access to the server can bypass this countermeasure by simply unplugging the server from its power source.
segment.target: A malicious user who has physical access to the server can bypass this countermeasure by simply unplugging the server from its power source.

segment.source: Possible values
segment.target: Possible values

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: The system paging file is cleared when the system shuts down normally.
segment.target: The system paging file is cleared when the system shuts down normally.

segment.source: Also, this policy setting forces the computer to clear the hibernation file (hiberfil.sys) when hibernation is disabled on a portable device.
segment.target: Also, this policy setting forces the computer to clear the hibernation file (hiberfil.sys) when hibernation is disabled on a portable device.

segment.source: Disabled
segment.target: Disabled

segment.source: Not defined
segment.target: Not defined

segment.source: Best practices
segment.target: Best practices

segment.source: Set this policy to Enabled.
segment.target: Set this policy to Enabled.

segment.source: This causes Windows to clear the paging file when the system is shut down.
segment.target: This causes Windows to clear the paging file when the system is shut down.

segment.source: Depending on the size of the paging file, this process might take several minutes before the system completely shuts down.
segment.target: Depending on the size of the paging file, this process might take several minutes before the system completely shuts down.

segment.source: This delay in shutting down the server is especially noticeable on servers with large paging files.
segment.target: This delay in shutting down the server is especially noticeable on servers with large paging files.

segment.source: For a server with 2 gigabytes (GB) of RAM and a 2-GB paging file, this setting can add more than 30 minutes to the shutdown process.
segment.target: For a server with 2 gigabytes (GB) of RAM and a 2-GB paging file, this setting can add more than 30 minutes to the shutdown process.

segment.source: For some organizations, this downtime violates their internal service level agreements.
segment.target: For some organizations, this downtime violates their internal service level agreements.

segment.source: Use caution when implementing this countermeasure in your environment.
segment.target: Use caution when implementing this countermeasure in your environment.

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.target: Stand-Alone Server Default Settings

segment.target: Disabled

segment.target: DC Effective Default Settings

segment.source: Policy management
segment.target: Policy management

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Restart requirement
segment.target: Restart requirement

segment.source: None.
segment.target: None.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a computer restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: Important information that is kept in real memory may be written periodically to the paging file to help Windows handle multitasking functions.
segment.target: Important information that is kept in real memory may be written periodically to the paging file to help Windows handle multitasking functions.

segment.source: An attacker who has physical access to a server that has been shut down could view the contents of the paging file.
segment.target: An attacker who has physical access to a server that has been shut down could view the contents of the paging file.

segment.source: The attacker could move the system volume into a different device and then analyze the contents of the paging file.
segment.target: The attacker could move the system volume into a different device and then analyze the contents of the paging file.

segment.source: Although this process is time consuming, it could expose data that is cached from random access memory (RAM) to the paging file.
segment.target: Although this process is time consuming, it could expose data that is cached from random access memory (RAM) to the paging file.

segment.source: Caution: An attacker who has physical access to the device could bypass this countermeasure by unplugging the computer from its power source.
segment.target: Caution: An attacker who has physical access to the device could bypass this countermeasure by unplugging the computer from its power source.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Enable the Shutdown: Clear virtual memory page file setting.
segment.target: Enable the Shutdown: Clear virtual memory page file setting.

segment.source: This configuration causes the operating system to clear the paging file when the device is shut down.
segment.target: This configuration causes the operating system to clear the paging file when the device is shut down.

segment.source: The amount of time that is required to complete this process depends on the size of the page file.
segment.target: The amount of time that is required to complete this process depends on the size of the page file.

segment.source: Because the process overwrites the storage area that is used by the page file several times, it could be several minutes before the device completely shuts down.
segment.target: Because the process overwrites the storage area that is used by the page file several times, it could be several minutes before the device completely shuts down.

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: It takes longer to shut down and restart the device, especially on devices with large paging files.
segment.target: It takes longer to shut down and restart the device, especially on devices with large paging files.

segment.source: For a device with 2 gigabytes (GB) of RAM and a 2-GB paging file, this policy setting could increase the shutdown process by more than 30 minutes.
segment.target: For a device with 2 gigabytes (GB) of RAM and a 2-GB paging file, this policy setting could increase the shutdown process by more than 30 minutes.

segment.source: For some organizations this downtime violates their internal service level agreements.
segment.target: For some organizations this downtime violates their internal service level agreements.

segment.source: Therefore, use caution before you implement this countermeasure in your environment.
segment.target: Therefore, use caution before you implement this countermeasure in your environment.
